meanings.definition: Willing to accept or agree to something.
meanings.sent1: She was very acceptant of new ideas and always willing to try them out.
meanings.sent2: The team leader was looking for an acceptant attitude from all members during the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed surprisingly acceptant of wearing a tiny hat for the photoshoot.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like an acceptant sponge, absorbing all the love and kindness around her.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a colorful and acceptant place, welcoming all types of flowers to bloom.

meanings.definition: A person or entity that accepts something.
meanings.sent1: The acceptant signed the delivery receipt without any hesitation.
meanings.sent2: The company was known for being a fair acceptant of feedback from customers.
meanings.sent3: The little robot was an eager acceptant of any commands given to it.
meanings.sent4: The old mailbox stood as a silent acceptant of letters and packages over the years.
meanings.sent5: The ocean was a vast and endless acceptant of rivers flowing into its waters.
